IERC20","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Calculates protocol fees (Capital Raising, Management/AUM, Transaction)      and routes them to designated treasury addresses.      Uses UUPS for upgradeability and PRBMath for precision.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"AddressEmptyCode(address)":[{"details":"There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract)."}],"ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address)":[{"details":"The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid."}],"ERC1967NonPayable()":[{"details":"An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost."}],"FailedCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted."}],"InvalidInitialization()":[{"details":"The contract is already initialized."}],"NotInitializing()":[{"details":"The contract is not initializing."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}],"UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext()":[{"details":"The call is from an unauthorized context."}],"UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32)":[{"details":"The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID."}]},"events":{"FeeRouted(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when calculated fees are routed to their respective treasuries.","params":{"carbonTreasuryAmount":"The amount sent to the carbon treasury.","protocolTreasuryAmount":"The amount sent to the protocol treasury.","repaymentRouter":"The address initiating the fee routing (RepaymentRouter).","totalFeeAmount":"The total amount of fee collected before distribution."}},"Initialized(uint64)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"calculateCapitalRaisingFee(uint256,address)":{"details":"Uses `developerRegistry` to check `timesFunded`.","params":{"developer":"The developer address (passed explicitly for verification against stored data).","projectId":"The project ID (used to fetch details)."},"returns":{"feeAmount":"The calculated fee in USDC units."}},"calculateManagementFee(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Uses PRBMath for time difference and applies tiered annual BPS rate pro-rata.","params":{"outstandingPrincipal":"The current outstanding principal of the loan.","projectId":"The project ID."},"returns":{"feeAmount":"The accrued management fee in USDC units for the period."}},"calculateTransactionFee(uint256)":{"details":"No hard cap is applied.","params":{"transactionAmount":"The amount of the transaction (e.g., repayment amount)."},"returns":{"feeAmount":"The calculated transaction fee in USDC units."}},"getCarbonTreasury()":{"returns":{"_0":"address The carbon treasury address."}},"getNextPaymentInfo(uint256)":{"params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project."},"returns":{"amount":"The amount to be paid.","dueDate":"The timestamp when the next payment is due."}},"getProtocolTreasury()":{"returns":{"_0":"address The protocol treasury address."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"getRoleMembers(bytes32)":{"details":"Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address)":{"params":{"_admin":"The address to grant initial administrative privileges.","_carbonTreasury":"Address of the treasury designated for carbon initiatives.","_developerRegistry":"Address of the DeveloperRegistry contract.","_protocolTreasury":"Address of the protocol's main treasury.","_usdcToken":"Address of the USDC token."}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"routeFees(uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `REPAYMENT_ROUTER_ROLE`.      Assumes the `feeAmount` is already held by this contract (transferred by RepaymentRouter).","params":{"feeAmount":"The total fee amount (already calculated) to be distributed."}},"setCarbonTreasury(address)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`.","params":{"_newTreasury":"The new carbon treasury address."}},"setProjectDetails(uint256,uint256,address,uint64)":{"details":"Called by authorized contracts (PROJECT_HANDLER_ROLE: ProjectFactory, Vault, PoolManager).","params":{"creationTime":"Timestamp when funding/loan started.","developer":"The address of the project developer.","loanAmount":"The total loan amount.","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project."}},"setProtocolTreasury(address)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`.","params":{"_newTreasury":"The new protocol treasury address."}},"setRepaymentSchedule(uint256,uint8,uint256)":{"params":{"paymentAmount":"The amount to be paid per period.","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","scheduleType":"The schedule type (1=weekly, 2=monthly)."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"updateLastMgmtFeeTimestamp(uint256)":{"details":"Should be called after management fees for a period are successfully processed/deducted.      Requires caller to have REPAYMENT_ROUTER_ROLE or PROJECT_HANDLER_ROLE (needs refinement).      Let's restrict to REPAYMENT_ROUTER_ROLE for now, assuming it triggers this post-calculation.","params":{"projectId":"The project ID."}},"updatePaymentSchedule(uint256)":{"params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project."}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"stateVariables":{"projectFeeInfo":{"details":"Mapping from project ID to its fee calculation details."}},"title":"FeeRouter","version":1},"userdoc":{"errors":{"PRBMath_MulDiv18_Overflow(uint256,uint256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when the resultant value in {mulDiv18} overflows uint256."}],"PRBMath_MulDiv_Overflow(uint256,uint256,uint256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when the resultant value in {mulDiv} overflows uint256."}]},"kind":"user","methods":{"calculateCapitalRaisingFee(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Calculates the Capital Raising Fee based on the loan amount and developer history."},"calculateManagementFee(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the Management Fee (AUM) accrued since the last calculation."},"calculateTransactionFee(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the Transaction Fee based on the transaction amount using tiers."},"getCarbonTreasury()":{"notice":"Gets the address of the designated carbon treasury."},"getNextPaymentInfo(uint256)":{"notice":"Gets the next payment information for a project."},"getProtocolTreasury()":{"notice":"Gets the address of the designated protocol treasury."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address)":{"notice":"Initializes the FeeRouter contract."},"routeFees(uint256)":{"notice":"Splits the total calculated fee amount and transfers funds to treasuries."},"setCarbonTreasury(address)":{"notice":"Updates the carbon treasury address."},"setProjectDetails(uint256,uint256,address,uint64)":{"notice":"Stores project details needed for fee calculations."},"setProtocolTreasury(address)":{"notice":"Updates the protocol treasury address."},"setRepaymentSchedule(uint256,uint8,uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the repayment schedule for a project."},"updateLastMgmtFeeTimestamp(uint256)":{"notice":"Updates the last management fee calculation timestamp for a project."},"updatePaymentSchedule(uint256)":{"notice":"Updates the payment schedule after a payment is params.developer: The developer address (passed explicitly for verification against stored data).
params.projectId: The project ID (used to fetch details).

returns.feeAmount: The calculated fee in USDC units.

calculateManagementFee(uint256,uint256).details: Uses PRBMath for time difference and applies tiered annual BPS rate pro-rata.

params.outstandingPrincipal: The current outstanding principal of the loan.

returns.feeAmount: The accrued management fee in USDC units for the period.

params.transactionAmount: The amount of the transaction (e.g., repayment amount).

returns.feeAmount: The calculated transaction fee in USDC units.

params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.

returns.dueDate: The timestamp when the next payment is due.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params._admin: The address to grant initial administrative privileges.
params._carbonTreasury: Address of the treasury designated for carbon initiatives.
params._protocolTreasury: Address of the protocol's main treasury.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

routeFees(uint256).details: Requires caller to have `REPAYMENT_ROUTER_ROLE`.      Assumes the `feeAmount` is already held by this contract (transferred by RepaymentRouter).

params.feeAmount: The total fee amount (already calculated) to be distributed.

setProjectDetails(uint256,uint256,addres.details: Called by authorized contracts (PROJECT_HANDLER_ROLE: ProjectFactory, Vault, PoolManager).

params.developer: The address of the project developer.
params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.

params.paymentAmount: The amount to be paid per period.
params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.

updateLastMgmtFeeTimestamp(uint256).details: Should be called after management fees for a period are successfully processed/deducted.      Requires caller to have REPAYMENT_ROUTER_ROLE or PROJECT_HANDLER_ROLE (needs refinement).      Let's restrict to REPAYMENT_ROUTER_ROLE for now, assuming it triggers this post-calculation.

params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

calculateCapitalRaisingFee(uint256,addre.notice: Calculates the Capital Raising Fee based on the loan amount and developer history.

calculateManagementFee(uint256,uint256).notice: Calculates the Management Fee (AUM) accrued since the last calculation.

calculateTransactionFee(uint256).notice: Calculates the Transaction Fee based on the transaction amount using tiers.

getCarbonTreasury().notice: Gets the address of the designated carbon treasury.

getNextPaymentInfo(uint256).notice: Gets the next payment information for a project.

getProtocolTreasury().notice: Gets the address of the designated protocol treasury.

routeFees(uint256).notice: Splits the total calculated fee amount and transfers funds to treasuries.

setProjectDetails(uint256,uint256,addres.notice: Stores project details needed for fee calculations.

setRepaymentSchedule(uint256,uint8,uint2.notice: Sets the repayment schedule for a project.

updateLastMgmtFeeTimestamp(uint256).notice: Updates the last management fee calculation timestamp for a project.

updatePaymentSchedule(uint256).notice: Updates the payment schedule after a payment is made.
